cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast, forecast to cross Florida’s Big-Bend coast Thursday night, then track along the coastal plain of GA/SC and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland, FL northward to South Santee River, SC (Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane: Suwannee River to Mexico Beach, FL;  Tropical-Storm: Anclote River to Suwannee River, FL and Mexico Beach to Destin, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast Big Bend, then Georgia and Carolina Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low risk; only a 3–5 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds. Occasional gusty squalls possible Thursday night–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Port of Palm Beach side of the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer-band showers, generally under 2 inches total.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk and higher surf along Palm Beach County beaches.
